meanings.definition: A unit of measurement equal to one hundredth of a meter.
meanings.sent1: The ruler showed the length in cunits.
meanings.sent2: She measured the fabric in cunits to ensure accuracy.
meanings.sent3: The tiny ant thought a cunit was a huge distance to travel.
meanings.sent4: In the land of miniature creatures, a cunit was as vast as a mountain.
meanings.sent5: The cunit on the measuring tape was marked with a tiny line.

meanings.definition: A small, separate unit or group within a larger organization.
meanings.sent1: The marketing team was a cunit within the company.
meanings.sent2: Each department operated as a cunit to achieve common goals.
meanings.sent3: The cunit of enthusiastic employees always brought new ideas to the table.
meanings.sent4: In the puzzle of the workplace, each cunit was a unique piece.
meanings.sent5: The cunit of friends always sat together during lunch breaks.

meanings.sent1: The students cunits to work on the project.
meanings.sent2: Neighbors cunits to organize a community event.
meanings.sent3: The ingredients cunits to create a delicious dish.
meanings.sent4: The melodies cunits to form a beautiful harmony.
meanings.sent5: The team cunits their efforts to win the championship.
